intro: Brachyscome dichromosomatica var. dichromosomatica, commonly known as the silver frost dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive silver-white foliage and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–30 cm and prefers well-drained soils in full sun. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for. The species is also noted for its ability to thrive in coastal and sandy environments.
